intro: Omphalea cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf physostegia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Omphalea cordata is also known for its latex-containing stems, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
